snippet: By Saturday evening, some 6,000 migrants had already arrived here, and another 1,800 were expected to arrive in trains overnight, according to the German police.
abstract: Germans gather at train station in Munich to welcome first group of what is expected to be about 8,000 migrants to arrive over weekend; arrival culminates 10 days of intense debate and emotion as Hungary sought to prevent migrants from moving through to Austria and Germany; situation highlights need for Europe to define its policies around ongoing wave of migrants fleeing Middle East and Africa.

byline.original: By KATRIN BENNHOLD, STEVEN ERLANGER and ALISON SMALE
byline.contributor: Katrin Bennhold reported from Munich, Steven Erlanger from London, and Alison Smale from Nickelsdorf, Austria. Reporting was contributed by Melissa Eddy from Berlin, Anemona Hartocollis from Vienna, Rick Lyman and Palko Karasz from Budapest.

lead_paragraph: By Saturday evening, some 6,000 migrants had already arrived here, and another 1,800 were expected to arrive in trains overnight, according to the German police.

headline.main: Germans Welcome Migrants After Long Journey Through Hungary and Austria
headline.print_headline: Germany Welcomes Thousands of Weary Migrants

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
